p: Leprosy elimination efforts have been complicated by the diseaseâ€™s long latent period (of up to 20 years), the lack of a single diagnostic tool enabling early detection, and the complex and varied clinical presentation. From an operational perspective, recent declines in case detection and case identification activities in high-endemic settings have negatively affected diagnosis and treatment coverage [ 53]. Indeed, there is evidence that pressure to achieve the elimination target at the national level may have led to less active case finding, diagnosis, and reporting, thus artificially resulting in lower prevalence figures [ 54].
